Posts.Content: Jo I have my last chemo on 13th Jan. I am booked for surgery for 21st February. I was told that 4 to 6 weeks minimum wait to allow your body to recover enough from the chemo to cope with the surgery. Mine is a mastectomy and Reconstruction surgery. Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Gap between chemo and surgery and radiation

Posts.Content: I survived many a day on a mcflurry and chilled honeydew melon.  I was given some nystatin by the chemo unit and that did help.  ...........Hope it passes soon... JILLY XX
Posts.Title: Oh my mouth...

Posts.Content: hello. I am having zometa 6monthly. I had my second one late November and in the past 3weeks have been experiencing really bad joint pain in my feet and knees and a little in my hips. Has anyone else experienced this? Thank you Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Zometa and joint pain

Posts.Content: Morning ladies and gents yesterday I had  ft mastectomy and deep flap reconstruction, however my flap failed so although i have had successful surgety on my tummy and a mastectomy the flap would not not maintain a blood supply and after 5 attempts they had to abort the surgey. the surgeons said that this is not something they have ever experienced before and that they think it is possibly a problem with.my blood vessels. i am too scared to look at m chest as this wasn't part of my plan and I had not thought about this scenario...........what do I do about bras etc.........I am so sad........ Jilly xx
Posts.Title: failed deep flap

Posts.Content: Hello ladies,  thank you for your support and replies, I have only today felt up to reading them. I have begun to accept what has happened and have ordered some mastectomy bras and have a softie from the hospital and a knitted knocker on order. I am not going to make any decisions just yet but will keep you posted.  I understand that for many ladies and gents a mastectomy is a choice and that they are happy with that, and in time I may well be too.....it just wasn't what I had expected to wake up to. I have to say that all the team at my hospital have been brilliant and very supportive. Xx jilly xx
Posts.Title: failed deep flap

Posts.Content: wombat.23  thats really good news..............I hadn't thought about it but I think I'm in that cub too xxx Jilly xx
Posts.Title: So what am I?...

Posts.Content: I had my eyebrows tattooed before I started my chemo and I am so pleased I did! It made me feel like I had some control left! Good luck on your journey Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer hopes and fears.

Posts.Content: Hello, I was just wondering if anyone else has problems with random bouts of diarrhea after chemo has finished. I had my last cycle of TCH on 13th January and have had one Herceptin injection on 6h February. I had stomach issues on day 6 after my herceptin which falls in line with what I had during my chemo so I assumed that that was a herceptin side effect but today would be day 19 after the herceptin and it has happened again. Any suggestions? Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Digestive issues

Posts.Content: I saw this on a different site and thought it just says it all....... Beautifully said ... stolen from a friend x  I am wearing a pair of shoes. They aren't pretty shoes… uncomfortable shoes. Each day I wear them. Each day I wish they'd feel more comfortable. Some days my shoes hurt so badly that I do not think I can take another step. Yet, I continue to wear them and continue my journey....I get funny looks wearing these shoes. I can tell in others eyes that they are glad these are my shoes and not theirs. They never talk about my shoes.... To learn how painful my shoes are might make them uncomfortable. To truly understand these shoes one must walk in them. But, once you put them on, you can never take them off. ...I now realize that I am not the only one who wears these shoes. There are many pairs in this world. Some women ache daily as they try and walk in them. Some have learned how to walk in them so they don't hurt quite as much. Some have worn the shoes so long that days will go by before they think about how much they hurt. Noone deserves to wear these shoes. Yet, because of these shoes I am a stronger woman. These shoes have given me the strength to face anything. They have made me who I am.  ~ Unknown
Posts.Title: Shoes

Posts.Content: Hello, Can anyone please tell me a bit about the sentinel node surgery, how long it took and how quickly you recover from it. I am having the  Injection on 14th and surgery on 15th Feb. Thank you Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Sentinel Node surgery

Posts.Content: Thank you for your replies.  I am going in for the dye injection on 14th and then early morning surgery on 15th. My daughter wants me to go to the wedding fayer at olympia with her on 17th and was hoping I may be able to manage it.....have to wait and see..... Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Sentinel Node surgery

Posts.Content: I certainly edge towards the disliking  it side of this campaign. I have asked a couple of friends who suggested doing this that I would prefer that they found other ways to raise money and to support me. However, I also understand that when faced with the fact that a friend or relative has been given a potentially life reducing diagnosis , some people feel unable to support other emotionally and want to show that they are there for them in what ever way they feel they can. Personally I have not been ashamed or bothered by my hair loss and proudly sport my baldness out and about, in shops and restaurants , unless my head is cold wear a hat. I do have a beautiful wig but don't like how it feels and I am more self conscious in it that with out it. I should say the best thing I did was to have my eyebrows tattooed pre chemo and and so pleased with them.......for me losing my eyebrows was a bigger worry that hair! I suppose it is a personal choice about baldness, hair loss, wigs hats etc. and whilst I would never condone the brave the shave I would also allow others to do their bit as they see fit.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: My son is going sober for October....No mean feat for an 18 year old!! Jilly x
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hello all, I just wanted to send everyone a New Years message. I am hoping for me that 2017 is going to be the year of good news, of positive steps forward to good health and to being cancer free. However I am realistic enough to know that may not be the case for me or for many of us on here............so I want to wish for you all the the best possible outcomes for each and everyone of you without too many hiccups and hospital visits, without too much sadness and lots of sparkle, and for the continued support of this wonderful community. whatever 2017 brings remember that we are all fabulous and special xxx big hugs and Happy New Year in whatever guise that may be
Posts.Title: Happy new year?

Posts.Content: i know I have read on here before somewhere that there is some where you can send bras to.  Does anyone know the name of the place? Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Bra donations

Posts.Content: I had 6 doses of TCH and am now on 3 weekly herceptin injections. I didn't have any problems while on chemo but since finishing i get a strange sensation as if someone has just squeezed my bladder really hard and a feeling that I urgently need to pass urine, however after a couple of seconds it disappears and when I do go to the toilet I don't have any problems at all. Jilly x
Posts.Title: Bladder irritation?

Posts.Content: I have 4 pairs here 2 size xl and 2 size l. I am a 12 to 14. One  pair still has the label on and the other 3 hardly worn. I am more than happy to post them to you if you want them? I always wore them with my own knickers underneath....is that too much information????? jilly xxx
Posts.Title: Underwear woes after diep flap

Posts.Content: Hello, I wore the Primark big "holdy in " knickers, (that is my tem for them not the official one!) they were much cheaper than the m and s ones and were very comfy Jilly xxx
Posts.Title: Underwear woes after diep flap

Posts.Content: Hello all (((((((((hugs)))))))) I have my final chemo tomorrow ( as long as the snow holds off) an will giving that bell a jolly good ring! I was wondering how quickly after chemo I can go back to some normal activities, for example eating takeaways and sea food, cleaning my teeth with my electric toothbrush, mingling with normal people in normal situations etc. I have been very careful and without jinxing things have held my blood counts above 5 the whole way through. I have suffered all the side effects with chronic fatigue aches flu symptoms and so on including oral thrush and mouth ulcers....but i have not yet been il!!! I have surgery in 6 weeks and then radiotherapy so I am aware life will not really go back to normal but surely small steps towards normality will come soon? Jilly XX
Posts.Title: life after chemo

Posts.Content: My thanks are: 1  to all the amazing nurses, office staff, doctors, consultants surgeons, care assistants, radiographers......... ( and the list goes on,) who work for our wonderful NHS that provides us all with the care and free medication that we need to support us through this shitty disease 2 to my wonderful husband and children who are my rocks and without whom there would be no reason to fight this! My wish is that my children never have to go through the same journey, either for themseles or in support of a partner I wish you all a happier and brighter 2017...........the start of our furtures  Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Two thanks and a Wish...

Posts.Content: hello all you lovely people. i am nearly 9 weeks after my failed diep surgery and am going to see the plastics team on Wednesday to talk about implants and expanders.  About a week after I had my surgery I noticed a bulge centrally below my tummy scar. Although this hasn't got any bigger ( or smaller) it is becoming painful to touch and stings most of the time. I am wondering if this is a hernia or if anyone has had a similar experience. also on one end of the tummy scar I have what I believe is called a dog ear. Should I mention both of these to the surgeon next week or should I get a referral from my gp thank you in advance. Hope you are all making the most of the long weekend . Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Diep hernia?

Posts.Content: Jane Sorry your diep didn't work either. My expander was full and hard but now feels a bit like a hot water bottle. I did call the unit today and I am going up there this Wednesday to see the team. I am hoping this may push my surgery forwards a bit.  I had my diep in February and just want to get to the end now xx When are you due to have the expander exchanged? Jilly xxx
Posts.Title: Leaking expander

Posts.Content: Jane that was exactly what happened to me except they didn't put an expander in during the initial surgery in Feb. I ended up with a large heamatoma where my mastectomy was and had to have that removed. Then I had the expander put in.As I have other medical issues they will not consider any other type of reconstruction for me other than an implant.  I did however have my chemo before surgery so have done it the other at round to you. I hope all goes well in November. Xx Jilly xxx
Posts.Title: Leaking expander

Posts.Content: Carolyn yes the expander has worked. It is uncomfortable but a means to an end xx jilly xx
Posts.Title: Leaking expander

Posts.Content: good evening, i was just wondering if anyone has any experience of a leaking tissue expander? i had a failed diep reconstruction and had a tissue expander put in at the beginning of august. The last time I went to have fluid put into it the Dr asked if I felt it had reduced in size and I said it did appear to be smaller and less full than it had been. This time they filled it again to the point where she said they could not put any more fluid in as it was now full. However 10 days on and it feels very soft and almost as if it is emptying. I am thinking that a call to the BCN tomorrow but just wondered if anyone has any advice. Thank you Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Leaking expander

Posts.Content: Hello Carolyn Yes it is just saline solution used to expand the tissue. I am not feeling unwell or anything like that just wondered if any one else had experience this. And what the out come was. I also know it had moved last time I went to the hospital. I am due to see the big DR on 8th November, I am not sure if you remember my situation but as the diep surgery went so wrong and then I had a very large heamatoma they drs won't do anything to me without the top guys approval. I have however been put on the urgent(whatever that means) list to have the permenant implant put in. Hopefully this will be my final surgery now. Jilly xxx
Posts.Title: Leaking expander

Posts.Content: Good evening all, today I got my results following my mastectomy. I have had a complete response to the chemotherapy!!!! whoop whoop. i find out tomorrow if I will have radiotherapy . jilly xxx
Posts.Title: biopsy results

Posts.Content: And today's news is that radiotherapy is not needed xx 11 more herceptin injections and another attempt at reconstruction  and that's me done xx Jilly xx
Posts.Title: biopsy results

Posts.Content: Morning all, I have been told today by a friend that after a Mastectomy and SNB we should never use a razor under our arms again. Has any on else heard this and if so what do you do. My preference would be to wax but I have also heard this is not a good idea...... If you use an electric shaver what type do you recommend? Thank you. Jilly xx
Posts.Title: Under arm hair.......
